CatDescriptText: Portions of accompanying article for related images published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 26, 1955, pg. 10, reads: "Pittsburgh - Mrs. Harriet E. Lewis was married here Saturday at high noon to Dr. John W. Jamerson of Savannah, Ga., in a solemn high nuptial mass performed by Father Walter H. S. Parker in austere beauty of Holy Cross Episcopal Church. The wedding climaxed a round of enchanting pre-nuptial affairs given for the bride, who is the widow of the late Ira F. Lewis.  It was a charming wedding party, which included children of the couple.  The bride, who was given in marriage by her son Robert, chose a chic spring violet suit, made on dressmaker lines, and wore a double corsage of white orchids.  A fascinating orchid feather hat completed her costume.  Attendants - Mrs. Robert L. Vann, matron of honor, chose a svelte rose-beige wool suit, topped with a smart pink flower hat, and wore an orchid corsage.  The bride's two daughters, Mrs. Adelaide Scott and Mrs. Jayne Williams were attendants and were stunning in identical rosy red pencil slim suits with tiny calots to match. Dr. William Jamerson was best man for his father, while Dr. Burke Syphas, son-in-law of the groom, was and usher...Ushers, who were handsome in their morning outfits were Dr. C. C. Blow, Frederick Abels. Dr. Henry Primas, Dr. Robert Bolden and Bailey Williams.  Reception - A reception followed immediately in the church parlors, where the newlyweds greeted some four hundred or more guests.  At 2 o'clock a festive brunch was served at the Greene Hearthe [Hearth] with the bridal aides as hostesses... Dr. and Mrs. Jamerson will be at home at 525 East Henry Street, Savannah, Ga."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of women and men, from left: Dorthea Jamerson Wallace, William Jamerson lighting cigarette of Mrs. Syphax, Burke Syphax, Maylaine Jamerson Wallace, posed behind table for reception of Jamerson - Lewis wedding, in Greene Hearth
